scenario_name: Pilot Misjudgment on Cabin Pressurization (HFACS Level 1 Focus)
description: Due to a misjudgment, the pilot disregards initial cabin pressure warnings, leading to an uncontrolled increase in cabin altitude and requiring an emergency descent. No prior technical faults were present.

telemetry_events.description: Cabin pressure system fault occurs, pilot delays reaction.
Cabin altitude exceeds 10,000 ft, triggering emergency descent procedure.

maintenance_logs.action: Cabin pressurization system checked and found normal. Aircraft technically sound.

transcript.speaker: PF
transcript.dialogue: Okay, monitor it. Probably just a sensor, it should stabilize.

transcript.sound: Loud, continuous CABIN ALTITUDE warning chime.

transcript.speaker: PM
transcript.dialogue: Excess Cabin Altitude! Oxygen masks on! Emergency Descent!
